Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#9618~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562807178/job/23466735938)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562807178/job/23466735634)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8562807178/job/23466735852)
Very well done for getting all of this out. As Joel said, this is a great result.
What is the m in a_i^m?
done, update docs string

I am sorry for taking such a long time to review this. This is a great result. However, I feel that the readability could be improved. Some auxiliary lemmas which may be useful could be extracted from the proof also.
The following general topology lemma could be introduced (if mathlib experts in topology are ok with it):
```lean
lemma _root_.TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis.subtype
    {α : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α] {B : Set (Set α)}
    (h : TopologicalSpace.IsTopologicalBasis B) (p : α → Prop) :
    IsTopologicalBasis (Set.preimage (Subtype.val (p := p)) '' B) :=
  h.inducing (f := Subtype.val (p := p)) ⟨rfl⟩
```
The following may not be very useful as is, but could be generalized for `Equiv` (if we do not have it already!):
```lean
variable {𝒜} in
lemma preimage_fromSpec_eq_image_toSpec {f : A} {m : ℕ} (hm : 0 < m) (f_deg : f ∈ 𝒜 m) :
    Set.preimage (FromSpec.toFun f_deg hm) = Set.image toSpec := by
  sorry
```

Then, the skeleton of the proof could become
```lean
variable {𝒜} in
/--The continuous function `Spec A⁰_f → Proj|D(f)` by sending `q` to `{a | aᵢᵐ/fⁱ ∈ q}`.-/
def fromSpec {f : A} {m : ℕ} (hm : 0 < m) (f_deg : f ∈ 𝒜 m) :
    (Spec.T (A⁰_ f)) ⟶ (Proj.T| (pbo f)) where
  toFun := FromSpec.toFun f_deg hm
  continuous_toFun := by
    rw [((ProjectiveSpectrum.isTopologicalBasis_basic_opens 𝒜).subtype (pbo f).1).continuous_iff]
    rintro s ⟨_, ⟨a, rfl⟩, rfl⟩
    dsimp
    have h₁ : Subtype.val (p := (pbo f).1) ⁻¹' (pbo a) =
        ⋃ i : ℕ, {x | x.1 ∈ (pbo f) ⊓ pbo (decompose 𝒜 a i)} := sorry -- insert calc block here
    have h₂ : ∀ i, toSpec (f := f) '' {x | x.1 ∈ (pbo f) ⊓ pbo (decompose 𝒜 a i)} =
      (PrimeSpectrum.basicOpen (R := A⁰_ f) <|
        Quotient.mk'' ⟨m * i, ⟨decompose 𝒜 a i ^ m, SetLike.pow_mem_graded _ (Submodule.coe_mem _)⟩,
          ⟨f^i, by rw [mul_comm]; exact SetLike.pow_mem_graded _ f_deg⟩, ⟨i, rfl⟩⟩).1 := sorry
    rw [preimage_fromSpec_eq_image_toSpec]
    erw [h₁]
    rw [Set.image_iUnion]
    refine isOpen_iUnion fun i ↦ ?_
    erw [h₂]
    apply PrimeSpectrum.isOpen_basicOpen
```
Actually, the assertions `h₁` and `h₂` could be stated as separate lemmas.

Thanks for the suggestions! I looked at other lemmas about `isTopologicalBasis` and arrived at conclusion that the lemma should be called `isTopologicalBasis_subtype`.

I have extracted `h_2` out as a separate lemma as it is useful (asserting that image of a basic open set is basic open). But I left `h_1` alone, for the lemma seems not that important.

You are right! `preimage_fromSpec_eq_image_toSpec` is in mathlib already.

```suggestion
  hom_inv_id := ConcreteCategory.hom_ext _ _
    (ProjIsoSpecTopComponent.fromSpec_toSpec 𝒜 hm f_deg)
  inv_hom_id := ConcreteCategory.hom_ext _ _
    (ProjIsoSpecTopComponent.toSpec_fromSpec 𝒜 hm f_deg)
```

```suggestion
  h.inducing ⟨rfl⟩
```

In the 6 uses of `toSpec` in this file, for four of them you need to specify `f` with `(f := f)`. Do you think that this is an indication that `toSpec` should take `f` explicitly? Note that it is a definition, not a theorem, so the usual rule of "f can be determined by the type of toSpec" does not always apply.
This has been made explicit. I guess I originally imagined `toSpec` will always be followed by an input which is not the case anymore.

I find the `erw` a bit distasteful but running this line through the profiler it's very quick so I'm not sure if I should make a fuss about it. It can be fixed for example with
```lean
    Set.preimage_image_eq _ (toSpec_injective 𝒜 hm f_deg) ▸ by
  change _ = ToSpec.toFun f ⁻¹' _
  rw [Opens.carrier_eq_coe, ToSpec.preimage_eq, ProjectiveSpectrum.basicOpen_pow 𝒜 _ m hm]
  rfl
```
and the `change` could also be removed if you write some lemma saying that `ToSpec.toFun = ⇑toSpec`. Is this the morally correct thing to do here?
I have added a lemma that asserts that ` ⇑toSpec \-1' ... = ...` so a version of `TopSpec.preimage_eq` for the bundled version. This erw and the next one have been removed
What is this m? It's the degree of f, right? Maybe this should be mentioned in the docstring?
This has been fixed

```suggestion
```
Doesn't seem to be doing anything.
deleted
The order of `hm` and `f_deg` has changed between `fromSpec` and `FromSpec.toFun`.
nice catch, this has been fixed now!

Again does this `erw` indicate some missing lemmas, e.g. that `⇑fromSpec = FromSpec.toFun`? Again it does not seem to be important here (the `erw` is only taking 0.015 seconds on my machine). Could it be that other people will want to work with `fromSpec`, or is this construction only ever going to be used here? If you can imagine other people needing it later, maybe you should add this missing lemma and see if this is enough to change the `erw` to a `rw`.
`⇑fromSpec = FromSpec.toFun` I think this is a bad lemma perhaps, it seems to be the wrong direction.
The `erw` in this case is that Lean can't see `FromSpec.toFun` is the forward direction of the equiv `<FromSpec.toFun f_deg hm, ToSpec.toFun f, ...>`
I am not too worried about these `erw`s because they seem to be very quick. I just thought I'd flag them.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(AlgebraicGeometry/ProjectiveSpectrum/Scheme): `fromSpec` is a continuous function so that we have `Spec A^0_f = Proj | D(f)` as topological spaces

source.title: feat(AlgebraicGeometry/ProjectiveSpectrum/Scheme): sheaf component of $Proj| D(f) \to Spec A^0_f$
